title: Linearization of Newton's second law
abstract:
The geometric linearization of nonlinear differential equation is a robust
method for the construction of analytic solutions. The method is related to the
existence of Lie symmetries which can be used to determine point
transformations such that to write the given differential equation in a linear
form. In this study we employ another geometric approach and we utilize the
Eisenhart lift to geometric linearize the Newtonian system describing the
motion of a particle in a line under the application of an autonomous force.
Our findings reveal that for the oscillator, the Ermakov potential with or
without the oscillator term, and the Morse potential, Newton's second law can
be globally expressed in the form of that of a free particle. This study open
new directions for the geometric linearization of differential equations via
equivalent dynamical systems.
